articles.title: Nearly 1 in 4 Hong Kong students can't finish homework without AI, study shows
articles.description: A leading Hong Kong think tank has called for a centralised platform for AI in schools, revealing that while 95% of students use the technology, nearly one in four struggle to finish homework without it, putting their problem-solving and analytical thinking skills at risk.
articles.content: A leading Hong Kong think tank has called for a centralised platform for AI in schools, revealing that while 95% of students use the technology, nearly one in four struggle to finish homework without it, putting their problem-solving and analytical t... [3406 chars]

articles.title: Dr Jitendra announces 200 new ‘Automatic Weather Stations’ for Delhi, Chennai, Mumbai, Pune
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Jan 15: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences and MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh today announced a significant expansion of India’s urban weather observation infrastructure, with the deployment of 200 Automatic Weather Stations across four major metropolitan cities. Addressing senior officers, meteorology experts and stakeholders, the Minister said that 50 “Automatic Weather Stations” each will be installed in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, and […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Jan 15: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences and MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh today announced a signifi... [4045 chars]

articles.title: IIIT-A team wins 1st prize in Smart India Hackathon
articles.description: Prayagraj: The team \"Enigmaa\" of the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad (IIIT-A) won first prize in the Smart India Hackathon 2025 .
articles.content: Prayagraj: The team "Enigmaa" of the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad (IIIT-A) won first prize in the Smart India Hackathon 2025 Software Category, held at Sri Venkateshwara College of Engineering and Technology, Puducherry. This... [518 chars]

articles.title: Agra woman files FIR over ‘obscene social media reel’ watched by children
articles.description: The case has been registered under Section 296(b) (obscene acts and songs in public places) of the BNS and Section 67 of the Information Technology Act at the Cyber Crime Police Station, Agra.
articles.content: The case has been registered under Section 296(b) (obscene acts and songs in public places) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Section 67 (transmitting obscene material in electronic form) of the Information Technology Act at the Cyber Crime Police S... [1121 chars]

articles.title: Three day conference on Health Services starts at Patanjali University
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent HARIDWAR, Jan 15: A three day conference on ‘Health Services and Management Using Smart Techniques’ started here today at Patanjali University. The conference is being organised jointly by Patanjali University, IIT Roorkee, American Institute of Management and Technology, US’s Global Knowledge Foundation, BIS Dehradun and University of Mariland Eastern Shore’s Business Management and Accounts Department. The conference is being organised to unify the smart techniques for technology and management of health services. The conference started with the warm […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
HARIDWAR, Jan 15: A three day conference on ‘Health Services and Management Using Smart Techniques’ started here today at Patanjali University.
The conference is being organised jointly by Patanjali University, IIT Roorkee, Am... [1333 chars]

articles.title: This chip can make future phones thinner and faster through tiny ‘earthquakes’
articles.description: A chip that produces microscopic “earthquakes” could change smartphone design, allowing manufacturers to shrink internal components while boosting signal handling and data speeds using surface acoustic wave technology.
articles.content: Researchers from the University of Colorado Boulder, University of Arizona, and Sandia National Laboratories have developed a new device that generates controlled vibrations on the surface of a microchip. These waves could help future smartphones bec... [2208 chars]
